fields.description:
I just created a private fork of a public repository, and it looks as if the fork is visible for others than myself (not the contents, but the fact that it exists, and its name and description).  To see it, go to:

http://bitbucket.org/effbot/pil-2009-raclette/

and click Forks/Queues.

Not that it matters much in this case, but I would expect private repositories to be truly private.

Cheers /F
fields.summary: the name/existence of private clones seem to be visible to everyone

fields.description:
as long as the link 'follow'/'following' switches at once according to new state, so could change the count of followers of the repo.

BTW, the captions of these may be changed to 'follow'/'stop following', to reflect the 'action' in both cases, rather than 'action'/'state', as in 'follow'/'following'. That is for UI consistency ;)

Thanks.
fields.summary: when starting/stopping following a repo the count of followers doesn't update until page reload

fields.description:
See:\\
http://bitbucket.org/vspader/cog/changeset/d8fd1c2ccd99/#chg-Info.plist

Look at the Monkey's Audio line, and note that  in HTML, it says <amp>amp;<amp>apos;, whereas the actual change just has <amp>apos;. It looks like the ampersand was double-escaped.
fields.summary: Changelog ampersand changed to XML amp entity

fields.description:
Viewing http://bitbucket.org/effbot/pil-2009-raclette/changeset/0fefd3a7cfb8/ the sub-hunk highlighting isn't working quite right.  Lines 73-75 just have s/1/-1/ done do them, so those should be the only intraline changes marked up in that hunk.  Instead it shows line 75 being edited to line 73, which is strange.

Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Changeset viewer intraline changes wrong

fields.description: Row 57, //txplib_head.php//, where it includes the admin style the PHP code starts with a *<?* instead of a *<?php* which made the styles break on my testserver since it doesn't allow the shorter PHP declaration.
fields.summary: txplib_head.php has a <?, not a <?php

fields.description: Probably would help the sales pitch.
fields.summary: List notable projects hosted on BB

fields.description:
Especially for pbranch repos, it would be cool if one could filter the nodes shown:

* only nodes from a given set of branches, or
* all nodes except those from a given set of branches, and
* no merge nodes.

And then, for consistency, I guess also "only merge nodes".
fields.summary: Allow filtering of branches in changelog (BB-677)

fields.description:
On the PLANS page, the "using CNAME" link is broken.

I assume it should link to http://bitbucket.org/help/UsingCNAME.

This issue was marked as spam three times; you should probably fix that, too.
fields.summary: Using CNAME link broken on Plans page

fields.description:
Push on a fork should be able to automatically update a ticket on the issue tracker of the main repository.

Obviously, they should not change its state but just add a comment with the commit message and a link to the commit.
fields.summary: Update issue with Commit pushed to fork

fields.description:
Long commit message currently result in very long E-Mail subjects when using the Issue service.

http://www.bitbucket.org/mercurialeclipse/main/changeset/8eeab1f0cc2d/ is an example for this...
fields.summary: IssueService: Use commit summary (first line) instead of complete commit message as subject (BB-676)

fields.description:
It would be cool if links referencing a user or their items elsewhere on bitbucket referenced their cname'd host, rather than their directory on bitbucket (i.e clicking on my avatar on someones follow list should link to http://hg.lstoll.net , rather than http://bitbucket.org/lstoll ). And/Or have the directory on BitBucket 301 redirect to the CNAME, to help with SEO.

However the downside is that a user who has set their cname up incorrectly will experience lots of issues. It would be nice though.
fields.summary: Links to user on bitbucket.org to user CNAME

fields.description:
I setup a cname for my page at http://hg.lstoll.net , however my avatar isn't showing up. Checking the source shows a different URL than what is being used to display the avatar on the main site.

I've tried re-uploading the avatar, but it persists.
fields.summary: Avatar not showing on CNAME'd site.

fields.description: Email notifications from the issue tracker should include an anchor in the URL to take the user directly to the comment the message is about.
fields.summary: anchors in issue email URLs (BB-675)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have small downloads, images, etc as attached files to wiki pages, with images being inline as an attachment.

This is standard wiki stuff, so I'm sure you'll get there eventually. :)
fields.summary: Attachment to wiki pages

fields.description:
Optimize the loading of tags. Maybe the page could use AJAX or have an option to completely disable the loading of tags.

I maintain a Hg mirror of an SVN trunk with over 15000 revisions. All revisions are tagged svn.xxxxx. I found that in all pages of this project http://bitbucket.org/suriya/jikesrvm, each HTML page is about 14000 lines long and more than 99% of these lines are to list all the tags. This wastes server compute resources and bandwidth.
fields.summary: Optimize handling of tags

fields.description: Guess it doesn't change updated_on?
fields.summary: Bumping an issue does not move it to the top of the list
I don't need notification emails when I'm the one who updates an issue

fields.description: Currently, in the admin page, I see little "-" signs next to my name for permissions, even though I cannot un-permission myself.
fields.summary: Don't show icon indicating I can remove myself from having perms on my own repo

fields.description: In admin
fields.summary: Don't show delete-icon next to logged in user

fields.description:
The camera ricoh works with cheese but it doesn't with ekiga after I installed your r5U87x. In particular I see something completed distorted with horizontal stripes (synchronization?). With Skype I see the image but doubled and shifted.\\
I installed also the latest version of today.\\
I have a Vaio VGN-AR41E with Ubuntu 8.10.\\
Can I do something to improve the situation? Thanks a lot for your work\\
Daniele
fields.summary: Motion Eye on Ekiga
Commit message/fixed message broken

fields.description: If user is on IE6, of course..
fields.summary: Add warning on site that we no longer support IE6

fields.description:
If you want to have a contribution repositories (e.g. mercurialeclipse-contributions) it would be nice to be able to specify public push access for bitbucket users, so everyone can push his changes for review, possibly automatically on a named branch, named like the user who pushed.

I would then use this repository to cherry-pick (transplant) contributions from those branches.
fields.summary: Allow public push on a repository
mera name jhokap

fields.description: Right now, issue comments have a "created 3 months ago" or similar line. I think using "create" here sounds kind of weird. I think "written" would sound better and more natural.
fields.summary: "written about X hours left" in issue comment header is bad grammar

fields.description:
hi, first i came to the site unregistered and logged with openid tonky.name

then i wanted to use usual login/password to checkout wiki.

didn't know password.

so i unsuccessfully tried to change password - didn't know the old one. i used 'remind password', and got login 'TonKy' and pass to my email.

but i can't login with them, nor change password to something else, after logging with openid.

openid still works, but i want login/password to work too. help! :)
fields.summary: can't login with login/pass, after signing up/logging with openid

fields.description:
The attached patch is still a work in progress but it works :-)

Still missing:

* how to deal with auth/perms?
* what if a user choose "rdf" as repo name?
* what is the best way to generate absolute URLs?
* support for private & cnamed repos
* discuss with DOAP crew to add an HGRepository class
* do something useful with that ;)
fields.summary: Add DOAP and FOAF support

fields.description:
This is to avoid having people click the follow-link several times because they think nothing happened on the first click when the xhr-request takes too long to complete.

Will show the global load-icon onclick.
fields.summary: Show progress indicator when following/un-following a user/repo/issue

fields.description:
When using a CNAME to access the site, the "Repositories" drop-down list in the main-nav will sometimes include the username in the path for the repo urls.

=== Replication: ===

h1. Go to homepage via CNAME (http://hg.mclanahan.org/).
{code}
Repo URLs are correct (http://hg.mclanahan.org/p3pi-dev/)
{code}

h1. Click "Help" in the main-nav
h1. Repo links under "Repositories" now have the username in the url path (http://hg.mclanahan.org/pmclanahan/p3pi-dev/), which throws a 404.
fields.summary: Main nav Repositories items links problem with CNAME

fields.description:
Is this a feature or a bug?  For me it's a bug since Ctrl-I opens a\\
text field in an external editor in Vimperator.  And I would like to\\
edit the contents without //// inserted in between, or wherever my\\
cursor was.
fields.summary: Pressing Ctrl-I insert //// in the Create new issue > Content textbox.

fields.description:
If the user name of a Mercurial commit is just a plain mail address\\
not enclosed in angled brackets and without a real name in front of\\
it, the commit doesn't get associated with the BitBucket user with\\
the same mail address.
fields.summary: Usernames aren't matched if the commit's one is a plain mail address.

fields.description:
The links of the usernames on bitbucket.org/repo/all/ and all\\
other repository listings, like popular/, are broken.  They lead to\\
bitbucket.org/repo/all/USER or bitbucket.org/repo/all/popular/USER\\
instead of bitbucket.org/USER.
fields.summary: Links of usernames are broken on http://bitbucket.org/repo/all/

fields.description:
When uploading SSH keys BitBucket does not allow keys with an empty\\
comment field.  Thus keys generated with ssh-keygen -C'' are not\\
recognized as valid SSH keys.  The field is filled by default with\\
$USERNAME@$HOSTNAME by ssh-keygen.  Adding something after the trailing\\
whitespace makes BitBucket accept it again.
fields.summary: SSH keys generated with ssh-keygen -C '' are not recognized

fields.description:
possibly elsewhere. Now when I enter 'user  ' (with spaces at the end) it is ignored (as if there is no such user), while 'user' works nice...

Meanwhile, Unix login doesn't trim usernames either, so... I don't know really %)
fields.summary: please trim username in 'add writer' field

fields.description:
Actually, you can see who follow a repository (yours or not) but you can't know who follow a user (you or another).

I think it could be interesting to add this functionality and maybe even track changes about *your* followers in the summary page (public newsfeed).

(Assigned to eirik as seen with jespern on #bitbucket)
fields.summary: People followers

fields.description:
Af far as I could see, there is no way to see absolute date of changeset or another event, only relative (i.e. "N hours ago"). This is nice, but sometimes I need exact date to use it elsewhere. So:

h1. It is nice to be able to see absolute dates as well as relative. Maybe, it should be a profile option (display absolute dates or relative or both, selectable for everywhere or section-wise)
h1. While splitting "Recent activity" to "Today", "Yesterday", etc, what criterion do you use?.. If it's just a 24-hour delta before current moment, then it may be nice to split days at midnights of user's -local time. This may be an option of user his profile too. Thus member of even a timezone-spread project may orient himself in time in a habutual way.
Thanks.
fields.summary: show absolute date of changeset (BB-674)

fields.description: It seems to me as if it'd be fine to have "fork" automatically assume I wanted to name the repository the same way, fill that in, and then have the focus on the "Create fork" button.  Or, even better: create the fork with sane defaults, then take me to the admin page.  A user coming from github made this complaint, and it seems legitimate to me.  Hell, to be honest, something similar to the above might be better for making a repository, too; that's an awful lot of settings to give a user trying to just create a repo.
fields.summary: Forking takes too many steps

fields.description: When I try to add a version to the issue tracker, the version is always 'add-version' and not what I put in the text box.
fields.summary: Cannot add version through issue admin interface

fields.description:
Trying to create a cyrillic wiki page name (firefox 3.0.6 is set to utf-8) got 'internal server error' message, which should have gone to you admins too. Do you support UTF-8 page names?.. :) For example, here is a sample that failed: "Конечные автоматы"

It is work-aroundable indeed but a annoys a bit.

Thank you again for a great service.
fields.summary: wiki doesn't support cyrillic page names

fields.description:
First, thanks for great service, wish you to flourish and here is my tiny bit.

I've changed my e-mail in BitBucket profile half-way though repository history. Now old changesets are identified with someone else, though with same name, disjoint from my BitBucket account and avatar as well. Is is intended behaviour?..
fields.summary: when changing e-mails, identification resets

fields.description: If I have a group of testers, I would like to be able to allow them access to the Wiki and be able to post new issues the issue tracker but at the same time not be able to see or access my actual code or respond to tickets.
fields.summary: Issue Tracker and Wiki access.

fields.description:
TortoiseHg is using the stable/wiki page as our project's main web page.  Near the top of the wiki Home page are links for downloading binary packages.  Unfortunately, the repository links above the wiki include a download drop-down for repository source, and this can be confusing.

Would it be possible to hide the repository link bar (branches, tags,rss,atom, ... download) when viewing the wiki page?
fields.summary: Rename "download" link to "get source" or "download source"

fields.description: It would make fork notifications more interesting if you asked people why they are making the fork (to fix a bug, to add a particular feature, to experiment, etc)
fields.summary: Fork notifications are boring (BB-673)

fields.description: I love gist [ http://gist.github.com/ ], but I don't want to use github if I don't have to.  Can we have a Mercurial backed pastebin?
fields.summary: Repo-Backed Pastebin / Gists (BB-672)

fields.description: See attached screenshot, which was taken in Firefox 3.0.6
fields.summary: Layout glitch puts "Create New Issue" link behind gravitar

fields.description: Although perhaps handy for those customers cursed with multiple personality disorder, I have to admit that I'm slightly dubious whether allowing users to issue a pull request on their own repositories makes sense.
fields.summary: I slightly question whether I should be able to make pull requests on my own repository

fields.description:
I cannot seem to get fogbugz integration to work.

I added the Fogbugz services, and enter my fogbugz URL. When I commit a change to bitbucket, nothing seems to happen on the fogbugz end. (I made sure to include the BugzID: line at the end of my comment).

The URL I use in the CVSSubmit text field is:

hxxps://xxxxxx.fogbugz.com/

x=t --- I think the spam filter is triggering if I use the t.

where xxxxxx is my fogbugz on-demand site.

Out of desperation I also tried hxxp:// and also added CVSSubmit.asp to the end of the URL.
fields.summary: Fogbugz service not working?

fields.description:
Attempt to push to queue repo fails with the following error:\\
{{{\\
abort: repository is unrelated\\
}}}\\
even though patch queue repo has no recorded changes.

After initial qclone patch queue repo in .hg/patches is empty as expected\\
(tip is -1:000000000000). Then I pull from existing patch queue repo. Then I'm trying to push and getting this error. qpush also fails, although error looks different:\\
{{{\\
itkach@itkach-desktop:~/mwlib-patches/.hg/patches$ cd ../..\\
hg qpush https://bitbucket.org/itkach/mwlib-patches/\\
abort: patch https://bitbucket.org/itkach/mwlib-patches/ not in series\\
}}}
fields.summary: Push to patch queue repo fails

fields.summary: Repository listing on user homepage

fields.description:
When adding a macro for a tickets query, it displays well in the preview, but when saved it has problems.

(private) example can be found at http://bitbucket.org/craiv/ibelieve/wiki/Test

You can reproduce this by:

* creating a new wiki page
* adding the default macro clicking on "list all issues for query"
* click "preview", admire good markup
* click "save"
* see the result

looking at the markup it seems that\\
{{{\\
<a rel="<b>Issue <a rel=">\\
}}}

is *bad* and making the remaining markup fail.
fields.summary: Wiki "query" macro has problems

fields.description: Otherwise stuff like 'tip' will get stuck :-/
fields.summary: Always translate keywords to revision ids when caching downloads

fields.description:
Hi all,\\
if I have to specify two criteria for the same parameter, query will use only the last one. That's because there is collision of GET variables (&{param}=value) with the same name, the last overwriting the others.

As you are working on queries, I might find it useful to filter out tickets which are not assigned (responsible=nobody), but as "nobody" is not mapped in the database (I think so), this does not work yet.
fields.summary: Can't search issues where assignee is 'nobody' (BB-662)

fields.description: It would be cool if the paragraphs in emails sent out would be filled (word wrapped) at 70 characters or so. The standard textwrap Python module can do the grunt work.
fields.summary: Word wrap long lines in emails

fields.description:
A "assigned to me" tickets report is missing, in my opinion. In developing phases I often open a lot of tickets, and assign to me the ones I am working on. Filtering in this way will help a lot.

As an alternative (more flexible, but more complicated), the "query" menu might have a "save custom query" option, which adds the query to the list.
fields.summary: List assigned issues (or, "save custom query") (BB-660)

fields.description:
Coming to the BitBucket front page for the first time, it's quite hard to see how to search for the repository you want. There are multiple text input boxes, but they are all for login and/or OpenID input. It's not that obvious that you must click on the "repositories" link.

A prominent serach box entitled "Find repository" (or similar) would help a lot.
fields.summary: put a "search repositories" box on the front page

fields.description: If you choose the "only use issue tracker form main" idiom here on Bitbucket, it should be easy to see which issues would be changed and how they would be changed when you are about to import a fork.
fields.summary: Generate a list of issue-actions via macro or simple page

fields.description: eg: http://bitbucket.org/repo/all/popular/2/ The + is centered.
fields.summary: CSS issue with "Create new" on /repo/all/ page

fields.description:
Should be more like:

user | r1235 | mesage

I'd prefer that at least. Any thoughts?
fields.summary: Twitter broker: change output format

fields.description:
http://googlewebmastercentral.blogspot.com/2009/02/specify-your-canonical.html

Would certainly help to eliminate duplicate content.
fields.summary: Specify 'canonical' for CNAMEs

fields.description:
I'd imagine some of these things are probably already on the drawing board, since search has gradually been added for issues and so forth (and wiki <<issue 122>> would be Real Soon Now, right? :-)), but I came across an interesting use case to share:

I was actually contacted by a resourceful recruiter who found me on Github. This allowed him to send me targeted opportunities for Python and Ruby work, most of them using progressive practices and distributed SCM, often citing an appreciation for folks who contribute to open source. Pretty cool really, the kind of recruiter I want to keep a relationship with.

I told him about Bitbucket as something to be aware of as well, and he pointed out that there seems to be no easy way to search for users by location, as he can do on Github:

http://github.com/search

So there. Probably a big request, but site-wide search with lots of metadata and filtering. Go! :-)
fields.summary: User Profile Search, and other site-wide search enhancements (BB-39)

fields.description: I noticed you have two elements with the id="id_username" on the home page. Because of this, if you click the label "Username:" on the signup field, the cursor focuses in on the top username entry instead.
fields.summary: HTML error on home page

fields.description:
h1. Login and follow an issue
h1. Logout
h1. Go to the same issue as anonymous. Observe the "follow" button & icon.
h1. Create a new tab in your browser.
h1. Login to Bitbucket in the new tab
h1. Click the "follow" button in the other tab
h1. Observe that you apparently unfollowed the issue, when this was likely not the user's intention considering they clicked the "follow" button.
fields.summary: following from anon shouldn't make you unfollow
Problem with SSH access

fields.description: If you write something incorrectly in a ticket, there's no way to update it.  Maybe you can if you own the tracker?  But it's common to see the mistake immediately after submission; some time period during which you could edit the ticket would be nice (or, if you are the ticket reporter, if you could edit the ticket until someone took some other action on it).
fields.summary: Editing tickets

fields.description: I got HTML in the local email that looked like https://kumar303@bitbucket.org/kumar303/pip/ -- notably, the @ because %40. It's not a great link anyway (it gives a warning in the browser, because of the username), but it doesn't work at all when quoted.
fields.summary: Domains get URL-quoted (BB-659)

I am running Ubuntu 8.10 64-bit Kernel is 2.6.27-11-generic

lsusb:\\
Bus 003 Device 004: ID 05ca:1830 Ricoh Co., Ltd Visual Communication Camera VGP-VCC2

Have latest r5u87x driver loaded all seems well.

When I try to load Video_buf via modprobe it gives the error in header, all Linux webcam apps fail to see web cam.    Any thoughts?

Hi,

The option to see a list of all public BitBucket repositories (along with the search function) is hard to find, since when I see a drop down list I don't expect to be able to click the title.

Arne

Cloning the wiki via HTTPS worked fine, but I would like to use SSH.

If I'm at /exogen, they try to go to /exogen/exogen.

fields.description:
After you get 2 points in Savage Fury the damege formula for Mangle(cat) is still the same(tooltip and damege). The others spell affected by formula [Rake and Claw are working fine,with formula changed[in tooltip and damege as also)].\\
Normal formula for rank 3 is:  160% normal damege plus 264. You can see in print that in tooltip is the same and should be (160% normal damege plus 264)*1.2

See attached screenshot.

(If I see another tin of spam and you drop my ticket on the floor again, that will be the last pretty picture I draw for you...)

fields.summary: Bazaar support

fields.description:
When a repository is forked, it may end up having lots of dependent repositories. If ownership is transferred (e.g. tortoisehg-stable moves from tksoh to steve), it would be nice if the repository and forks could move as well.

All forks should be updated to point to the new location of the repository.

Just adding commit permission allows multiple persons to commit, but moving a repository signals that ownership has been transferred, which is not the same.
fields.summary: Move repo and redirect forks

fields.description:
It's all here:\\
http://www.trinitycore.org/forum/project.php?issueid=1573\\
I'm hopping that you can fixed...
fields.summary: Druid Feral Issue

fields.description:
Another panel on the project for releases would be appreciated.

Some projects need to be able to bundle particular versions into a release.  These archives will not necessarily contain the same files as stored in the repository.  For example, some autoconf files won't be present, but the generated configure script will be present.  Similar issues occur with flex and bison.

An initial implementation would simply allow a series of .tar.bz2 files to be stored with some associated release notes.  A refinement would be automatically generated .tar.gz or .tar files upon download.
fields.summary: Projects Need Named Releases

fields.description: Example: http://bitbucket.org/puntoexe/imebra/issue/39/the-class-datahandlernumeric-calculates-the-wrong
fields.summary: → double escaped when updated by broker

fields.description:
The Singleton pattern doesn't work with new style classes (which includes Python 3.0)  I've tested using version 2.5.4 (used object in my class definition) and in version 3.0 and saw the same results. Finally the backticks are deprecated in 3.0 and should be replaced with repr().

**program output **(obviously your will differ)

In [56]: run SingletonPattern\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652C10>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652A90>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652F50>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652C10>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652A90>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652C10>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652A90>\\
<*main*.OnlyOne object at 0x01652F50>
fields.summary: singleton pattern doesnt work. SingletonPattern.py

fields.description:
h1. PayPal has historically engaged in questionable practices
h1. Even if they no longer do, it's weird and annoying that I have to make a PayPal account to pay for my Bitbucket account
fields.summary: Support a better payment system than PayPal

All links in feeds point to bb even with a cname.

E.g: http://code.welldev.org/django-storages/atom/

fields.description: In hgweb I can link to a specific line of a file in a source view, and I can't on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Line number specific links are nonobvious.

fields.description:
It's a common use to redirect a repository served by hgweb to a bb's one (at least I hope :). Here are my redirections (lighty setup):

{{{\\
#!python

url.redirect = (\\
"^/biologeek/rev/(._)?$" => "mydomain/biologeek/changeset/$1/",\\
"^/biologeek/archive/(._)?$" => "mydomain/biologeek/",\\
"^/biologeek/file/(._)?$" => "mydomain/biologeek/src/$1/",\\
"^/biologeek/log/(._)?$" => "mydomain/biologeek/changesets/$1/",\\
"^/biologeek/(rss|atom)-log$" => "mydomain/biologeek/$1/",\\
"^/biologeek/(log|shortlog)$" => "mydomain/biologeek/changesets/",\\
"^/biologeek/(summary|tags)?$" => "mydomain/biologeek/",\\
)\\
}}}

I wonder if it's a good idea to redirect those URLs before raising a 404 error given the facts it doesn't clash with an existing one in bb.
fields.summary: Redirecting hgweb URLs before raising a 404

fields.description: See the link on http://bitbucket.org/jezdez/pip/descendants/, it reads https://bitbucket.org.org/ionelmc/pip-win-patches/
fields.summary: Link b0rked on patch queue overview (descendants)

fields.description: When you are logged in and you click your profile you shouldn't have the option to follow yourself.
fields.summary: when logged in, you shouldn't have the option to follow yourself

fields.description:
It's currently possible to download an archive of a specific revision by commit id (e.g. http://bitbucket.org/user/project/get/123456789abc.zip).

It would be nice if this would also work for tags (e.g. http://bitbucket.org/user/project/get/v0.9.zip).

Btw: My I suggest to name tarballs .tar.gz (instead of just .gz) so they are handled properly by file managers.
fields.summary: Allow for download of tagged revision.
Broken output from milestone tag in wiki (BB-532)

fields.summary: Clicking username in a bucket view 404s

fields.description:
# Go to http://bitbucket.org/mozillahispano/
# Click on mozillahispano user name
# You get a 404

As a result, external redirections are failing. For example

http://hg.mozilla-hispano.org/mozillahispano/tuentifox/

now gives a 404.
fields.summary: Something weird is happening with the URLs
